section.title: Content
section.para: The source package contains the following:

listitem.para: Contains the files of this document.
Contains the XML configuration schemas, to use to validate your configuration files.
Contains all the latex stuff: LaTeX style files, logos, and scripts to compile the LaTeX output.
Several scripts, including the main script of the package.
XSL stylesheets.
Test files.

section.title: Dblatex Packages
section.para: Dblatex is packaged for these Systems or Distributions:

listitem.para: Linux Debian, Ubuntu,
Linux OpenSUSE (RPM), Linux Fedora (RPM),
FreeBSD, NetBSD,
Mac OS X (Fink).

section.para: If you are installing on one of these distributions, follow their recommended way of installation, and you can safely ignore the next sections that give details for installing dblatex from the source tarball.

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: To work, the following items must be available:

listitem.para: An XSLT. xsltproc is the default XSLT used, but one can also use 4suite or saxon.
The XML DocBook DTD.
A recent LaTeX distribution. The configure script checks that the needed latex packages are available.
Python >= 2.4.

section.title: Installing the dependencies
section.para: To use the package, install properly the dependencies:

listitem.para: Install Python if necessary.
Install LaTeX.
Install the XSLT. By default xsltproc is used.
Install the XML DocBook DTD.
Create a catalog file, that defines where to find the DTD. Here is an example:
If the XML Gnome tools are available, it's a good idea to create an XML catalog by using xmlcatalog such like this:
listitem.programlisting: % xmlcatalog --noout --create mycatalog % xmlcatalog --noout --add 'public' '-//OASIS//DTD DocBook XML V4.1.2//EN' \ 'file://path/to/4.1.2/docbookx.dtd' mycatalog

listitem.para: Add the catalog path to the SGML_CATALOG_FILES variable:
You can skip this step if you configure the dblatex installation with the --catalogs option.

section.title: Installing from the Python Egg
section.para: Since version 0.3.2 dblatex is distributed as a Python Egg in the Python Package Index (PyPI). It requires to have easy_install installed.

listitem.para: Call simply easy_install:

section.title: Installing on Windows
section.para: The following packages to install and the procedure is for a native Windows installation. If you want to use dblatex via Cygwin instead, you should consider it like a unix like install.

section.title: Dependencies
section.para:
The following applications are required:
An XSLT. xsltproc is the default XSLT used, but one can also use 4suite.
The XML DocBook DTD.
MiKTeX > 2.5.
Python >= 2.4.

section.title: Installing MiKTeX
section.para: Install the minimal distribution, and add the following packages: changebar, colortbl, fancybox, fancyhdr, fancyvrb, listings, overpics, rotating, subfigure, titlesec, bibtopic, enumitem, eepic, lm, lastpage, helvetic, times, symbol, courier, footmisc, ifxetex, pdfpages, wasysym.
